content: - exit thunderbird on new pc - copy the thunderbird folder from the ....appdata\roaming\ folder from old PC and paste into c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the exiting thunderbird folder. - restart thunerbird
creator: davidsk

content:
Probabilmente è lo stesso problema discusso qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1442152

per cui valgono le stesse considerazioni:

Il tuo IP è inserito in una lista di spammer, per cui le tue email vengono bloccate. Se il tuo operatore lo permette, prova a cambiare IP Altrimenti contatta Tiscali perché ti sblocchino. Thuderbird c'entra nulla in questo caso. Ti mostra solo la risposta che ottiene quando contatta il tuo server di posta.

content: Are you wanting the attachment to be included on replies? It is not clear. Thank you.

content: I receive an e-mail with an attachment from person A. If a third person C replies to person A (and all other cc participants), the first original email with attachement is no longer in my Thunderbird mailbox as an original, but is in the history of person C's reply, but without an attachment. I want the original to be retained, as was customary in the past (and also today with outlook) (then I keep the attachment).
creator: koenig.sel

content:
Please post an image showing the Folder Pane. When you say 'local folders' do you mean 'Local Folders' mail account ?

'Drafts' and 'Templates' both have icons that look like a letter, so it sounds like you may have a folder which has been set up to be the chosen folder for Drafts or Templates.

Check Account Settings

  • Account Settings
  • Select 'Copies & folders' for the account which has the folder with wrong 'letter' icon

Check the 'Drafts and Templates' sections. So for Drafts.... If pop:

  • Select: 'Drafts folder on: and choose mail account name/email address

If imap:

  • Select 'Other' and choose eg: 'Drafts on mail account name/email address
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Junk will get emptied if you have set up Thunderbird to empty it.

You will need the following settings:

  • Account Settings
  • Select 'Junk Settings' for the account

DEstination and Retention:

  • Select 'Move new junk messages to:

If POP:

  • Select 'Junk folder on' and choose email address of account.

If IMAP:

  • Select 'Other' and choose 'Spam on mail account/email address'

DO NOT select the checkbox 'Automatically delete junk mail older than...

Please note: If this is an Imap mail account then you may discover the server is automatically deleting the contents of the Spam folder.

Also check the Global Settings:

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll to 'Junk' section
  • Select: When I mark messages as junk
  • Select 'Move them to the accounts junk folder
  • Select 'Enable adaptive junk filter logging

Also check Junk/Spam folder:

  • Right click on folder and select 'Properties'
  • On 'Retention Policy' tab
  • Select 'Use my account settings'
  • Select 'Don't delete any messages'
creator: Toad-Hall
